bibl.title: Letter from John H. Andrus to Gustaf E. Lambert, May 18, 1937

div1.p: Andrus hopes that Lambert and Jessie Ames get the recognition they deserve.

div1.head: Letter from John H. Andrus to Gustaf E. Lambert, May 18, 1937

opener.dateline:
J.H. Anrus
805 Cooper St.
Camden, N.J.
5-18-37

div1.p:
Hope you have not despaired of my complying with your request
for help. The fact is that I have no one to do any typing for me
and it is rather difficult to put a typewriter beside me in bed -
turn over on my side and poke the letters out with one finger.

I sincerely hope that Mrs. Ames and you both get the recognition
you so kindly deserve. If anything I can do will help attain that
end it will make me very happy. Please keep me informed.

Everything with me is about as usual except that I'm having more
than my share of neuritis.
Hope, that the fates are treating you and Mrs. Lambert kindly.

Have not heard from Schwieger for quite a while. Give my best
regards to him when you meet.

Mrs. Andrus joins me in sending kindest regards and best wishes to
you and Mrs. Lambert.
